title: Jacquline Jossa worries fans with cryptic caption as she shares stunning selfie
text:
Get the biggest celebs stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Jacqueline Jossa has made a cryptic post as she shared her latest selfie on Friday afternoon.

The former EastEnders actress, 26, posted the thank you hands and the right arrow emoji in the caption of the Instagram post.

It appears to read "thank you, next", referencing the famous song by Ariana Grande .

The lyrics to the track were also written on the black t-shirt she wears in the picture.

Jacqueline, who is married to ex TOWIE star, Dan Osborne sported a full face of makeup in the snap, which was taken in the mirror of what appears to be her hallway.

(Image: Instagram)

She sported pink eyeshadow, false lashes and heavy blusher, which she pulled together with nude lipstick.

The mum-of-two accessorised with her wedding and engagement rings, which she flashed when she held up her iPhone to take the photo.

Her post was flooded with comments from her many Instagram followers, with some questioning what the caption was about.

Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now

One posted: "Can actually tell you and Daniel have had an argument with the things you're both posting today."

"Look so beautiful," another commented, alongside a pair of heart eyes emojis.

A third wrote: "Looking gorgeous as always."

In August Jacq's husband Dan was seen leaving a nightclub with a woman he denied having an affair with.

They have had a rocky marriage since tying the knot in 2017. The pair started dating in 2013.

Dan has been accused of cheating on numerous occasions, but insists that this isn't true and his relationship with Jacqueline is fine.
description: The former EastEnders actress, 26, posted 'thank you, next' when she shared her latest Instagram photo
